intro: Cracca purpurea var. longifolia, commonly known as the purple cranesbill, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture and emits a mild, slightly spicy scent. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. This perennial is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
